query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Ora sen va per un secreto calle, 2 tra ’l muro de la terra e li martìri, 3 lo mio maestro, e io dopo le spalle.
query.error: **English:** 1 Now my master goes along a hidden path, 2 between the wall of the city and the torments, 3 and I behind his shoulders.
query.result: 1 Wosa hemma a wra a-dro fordh kudh, 2 ynter mur an cita ha'n martyris, 3 y'm mester, ha my wosa y'n-golgh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 «O virtù somma, che per li empi giri 5 mi volvi», cominciai, «com’ a te piace, 6 parlami, e sodisfammi a’ miei disiri.
query.error: **English:** 4 "O supreme virtue, who through the impious circles 5 turned me," I began, "as it pleases you, 6 speak to me, and satisfy my desires.
query.result: 4 "O usel uhella, dre drehedh an geryow 5 vy," me a dhallethas, "keparth dhys, 6 kewsel dhyn vy, ha godhvos dhe'm dysyr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 La gente che per li sepolcri giace 8 potrebbesi veder? già son levati 9 tutt’ i coperchi, e nessun guardia face».
query.error: **English:** 7 Can the people who lie in the sepulchers 8 be seen? Already the lids have been lifted, 9 and no one stands guard.
query.result: 7 An bobel a wra yn gorhel an begrau 8 a yll bosvos gweles? Nebes an kovrow 9 oll awos, ha nyns eus neb a wra wartha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 E quelli a me: «Tutti saran serrati 11 quando di Iosafàt qui torneranno 12 coi corpi che là sù hanno lasciati.
query.error: **English:** 10 And those to me: "All will be closed 11 when they return here from Jehoshaphat 12 with the bodies they left up there.
query.result: 10 Ha henna dhym: "Oll a vydh klowsys 11 pan wra henna a Yosafat dhe-dhi 12 gans an korfow a whedhas allá."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Suo cimitero da questa parte hanno 14 con Epicuro tutti suoi seguaci, 15 che l’anima col corpo morta fanno.
query.error: **English:** 13 Their cemetery on this side have 14 with Epicurus all his followers, 15 who make the soul die with the body.
query.result: 13 Aga myntira a-dhyworth an tu-ma 14 gans Epikuros oll y dhiskibion, 15 a wra an eneval gans an korf marow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Però a la dimanda che mi faci 17 quinc’ entro satisfatto sarà tosto, 18 e al disio ancor che tu mi taci».
query.error: **English:** 16 But to the question that you ask me 17 here within you will soon be satisfied, 18 and also to the desire that you keep silent about.
query.result: 16 Mes dhe'n gows a wra gwres dhyn vy 17 ama yma bydh sodhvos bys vy a-dhia, 18 ha dhe'n dysyr a wra tewlel dhyn vy."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 E io: «Buon duca, non tegno riposto 20 a te mio cuor se non per dicer poco, 21 e tu m’hai non pur mo a ciò disposto».
query.error: **English:** 19 And I: "Good leader, I keep nothing hidden 20 from you in my heart except to say little, 21 and you have disposed me to this not only now."
query.result: 19 Ha my: "Arluydh da, vy cor nyns eus kuul 20 dhys vy namoy mes rag leverel byghan, 21 ha'th eus vy nyns pur dhe'm dhe-dhi dysposys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 «O Tosco che per la città del foco 23 vivo ten vai così parlando onesto, 24 piacciati di restare in questo loco.
query.error: **English:** 22 "O Tuscan, who through the city of fire 23 goest living thus discoursing so discreetly, 24 it pleases me that thou shouldst stay in this place."
query.result: 22 "O Tuskek, drehedhes drehedhes an drehev tan, 23 ow tewlel vyw an mann ma, 24 ow tyj dhe wosa y'n le mayn."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 La tua loquela ti fa manifesto 26 di quella nobil patrïa natio, 27 a la qual forse fui troppo molesto».
query.error: **English:** 25 Thy speech bewrayeth thee to be 26 of that noble fatherland to which perchance 27 I was too irksome."
query.result: 25 Dha lavar a wra'th ow konta 26 a'n wlas nobl ena genes, 27 ena genes owth oen kammles."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Subitamente questo suono uscìo 29 d’una de l’arche; però m’accostai, 30 temendo, un poco più al duca mio.
query.error: **English:** 28 Suddenly this sound came forth 29 from one of the arches; therefore I approached, 30 fearing, a little closer to my guide.
query.result: 28 Yn subit an son ma a dheuth 29 a-dhyworth unn a'n archys; rag orth y'm a dheuth, 30 ow tyn, unn byghan moy dhe'm an dygh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Ed el mi disse: «Volgiti! Che fai? 32 Vedi là Farinata che s’è dritto: 33 da la cintola in sù tutto ’l vedrai».
query.error: **English:** 31 And he said to me: “Turn around! What are you doing? 32 See there Farinata who has risen up: 33 from the waist up you will see him all.”
query.result: 31 Ha thera vy: “Treyly! Pyth yw gwreydh? 32 Gwel eno Farinata a syth sevel: 33 a-dhyworth an gweli bys vy dhe'n gweli.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 37 Ha'n dhew an dus ha'n dygh an dygh ha prest 38 a'm pys dhe'n beyn an begrau dhe'gan, 39 ow leverel: “Bew orth an gerow geryes.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Com’ io al piè de la sua tomba fui, 41 guardommi un poco, e poi, quasi sdegnoso, 42 mi dimandò: «Chi fuor li maggior tui?».

query.result: 40 Pyth o vy dhe'n traes y venen, 41 y'm gwelas vy unn byghan, ha wosa, avel marow ow tos feth, 42 y'm gorra vy: “Pandr yw an dus moyha?”
